intro: Plectronia bispathacea, commonly known as the two-pathed plectronia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to survive.
